unnormalised: Okay, here's a news snippet about EV charging, tailored to your specifications:

normalised: Mumbai drivers, listen up! The E V charging scene is getting a major boost, thanks to I I T Bombay working on next-gen, faster charging tech. Remember that scene in "Dhoom" where they needed a quick nitrous boost? Well, think of this as the electric version!

unnormalised: Mumbai drivers, listen up! The EV charging scene is getting a major boost, thanks to IIT Bombay working on next-gen, faster charging tech. Remember that scene in "Dhoom" where they needed a quick nitrous boost? Well, think of this as the electric version!
normalised: Tata Power just announced they're adding a bunch of new charging points across Maharashtra, especially along the Mumbai or Pune expressway. We're talking both slow and fast chargers, so no more range anxiety on your Khandala getaways.

unnormalised: Tata Power just announced they're adding a bunch of new charging points across Maharashtra, especially along the Mumbai-Pune expressway. We're talking both slow and fast chargers, so no more range anxiety on your Khandala getaways.
normalised: Apparently, they are planning to install over five hundred charging points by the end of next year. Cost? Early estimates suggest you'll be looking at around rupee fifteen to twenty per unit.

unnormalised: Apparently, they are planning to install over 500 charging points by the end of next year. Cost? Early estimates suggest you'll be looking at around Rs. 15-20 per unit.
normalised: A recent survey shows E V owners in Delhi are traveling an average of eighty kilometer per charge, so that extra juice is crucial. This is a game-changer for long-distance travel and daily commutes.

unnormalised: A recent survey shows EV owners in Delhi are traveling an average of 80 km per charge, so that extra juice is crucial. This is a game-changer for long-distance travel and daily commutes.
normalised: Looks like going electric is becoming less of a headache and more of a *bijli* (electricity) powered breeze!

unnormalised: Looks like going electric is becoming less of a headache and more of a *bijli* (electricity) powered breeze!
